comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See xroads.virginia.edu/~Museum/Armory/galleryI/picabia.418.html for a slightly different painting with the same name, captioned as "Believed to be Souvenir de Grimaldi, Italie shown in the Armory Show." xroads.virginia.edu/~MUSEUM/Armory/gallerytour.html is an attempt to reproduce the 1913 International Exhibition of Modern Art, aka the Armory Art Show, which also toured to Boston and Chicago in reduced form.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Feb 16, 1913 has a piece in Picabia with several photos of works. See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D04E0D81539E632A... The picture at the left-hand side of the article appears to be this one. It is captioned "A River Running through a Canyon." Perhaps it was an early version of the one in the Armory show.
